content.content: GovAlpha is the current steward of the makerdao community repository on github. We have decided to clear out the main branch of the repository, due to age and the amount of deprecated and no-longer used content. I have created a PR that achieves this, which is linked below.  Removed folders /blogPosts - Contains blog content that has been replicated elsewhere. /contributing - Guides to contributing to this repo, no longer applicable. /faqs - Duplicated in the content folder which remains. /flow-typed - Unused generated code. /grants - Details of no-longer-active grants program + historic audits. /hackathons - Details of no-longer-active hackathon programs. /meetups - Details of no-longer-active meetups programs. /onboarding - Onboarding for vaults and voters, replaced by MOM content. /risk - Collateral Onboarding Guides, no longer applicable. /scd-faqs - SCD FAQ’s no longer relevant. /src - No longer used front-end code. /static - Static content no longer referenced by any front-ends. /translations - Translation guides, no longer applicable.  Remaining folders /governance - Contains actively used governance polls/votes/delegate profiles. /content - Contains introductory content that is not currently live elsewhere.  If you think anything mentioned here might still be in active use by a front-end, or is regularly referenced by you or contributors you know, please get in touch asap. A snapshot of all content prior to clean-up will be accessible on the ‘prior-cleanup’ branch in perpetuity.    github.com/makerdao/community         DO NOT MERGE YET: Nuked the repo.   makerdao:master ← LongForWisdom:master              opened 03:43PM - 09 Jan 23 UTC                 LongForWisdom               +2 -114054       * Removed out of date content. * Removed publishing-related content. * Removed… github build actions. * Now just governance stuff + introductory content (also out of date, but best we have)
This has now been merged. Please let us know if you have any issues.
Should we close all the issues too? Probably good to move on from Foundation now that Governance/community is managing the repo.
It’s on the to do list. I closed out a load of old PRs last week, planning to tackle the issues next week
Hmu if you need additional documentation or anything!
